content: That's really interesting. I didn't know that existential authenticity was tied to personal growth and self-reflection. I've been thinking a lot about my own values and beliefs lately, and I've realized that I've been going through the motions of certain practices without truly believing in them. My conversation with my old friend from high school last week made me realize that I need to take responsibility for my choices and create my own meaning in life. Can you recommend some exercises or practices that can help me cultivate existential authenticity?
